Azure Data Lake Store destinationprereq: retrieve information from AzureprerequisitesAzure Data Lake Store destinationRetrieve information from Azure to help you configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination. When you configure the destination, you need the following information:
Client ID
Client Key
Auth Token Endpoint
Account FQDN
To retrieve this information, you will access both the classic and new Azure portals. At the time of writing, several properties are available only in the classic portal.

dlentry.dt: Retrieve the Client ID, Client Key, and Auth Token Endpoint from the classic Azure portal

ol.li:
If continuing directly from creating the web application, click Configure.
If starting fresh, log in to the classic Azure portal: https://manage.windowsazure.com. In the navigation panel, select Active Directory.
Select the account to use, then Applications. Then, select the web application.
The Properties page appears.

Scroll down the page and note the Client ID:
When you configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination, use this number for the Client ID property.

To retrieve the Client Key, continue to scroll down to the Keys section. If you already have a key generated, copy the key.
Otherwise, to generate a key, select a duration for the key, and then click Save:
The Azure portal saves your changes and generates a key. Copy the key value.
When you configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination, use this key for the Client Key property.
At the bottom of the Properties page, click the View Endpoints icon.

In the App Endpoints window, locate and copy the OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint URL.
When you configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination, use this URL for the Auth Token Endpoint property.
Click the Check icon to close the window.

dlentry.dt: Retrieve the Account FDQN from the new Azure portal

ol.li: Log in to the new Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com/.
From the All Resources list, select the Data Lake Store resource to use.

In the Essentials page, note the URL:
When you configure the Azure Data Lake Store destination, use the host name from this URL for the Account FQDN property. In this case, the host name is servicename.azuredatalakestore.net.
